device.name: LPC15xx
device.description: LPC15xx Cortex-M3 MCU; up to 64 kB flash; up to 12 kB SRAM; USB device; USART; EEPROM

field.name: PBYTE
field.description: Read: state of the pin PIOm_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. One register for each port pin: m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port 2. Write: loads the pin's output bit.

field.name: PWORD
field.description: Read 0: pin PIOm_n is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin PIOm_n is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit. One register for each port pin: m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2.

field.name: DIRP0
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin PIOm_n (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = input. 1 = output.

field.name: MASKP0
field.description: Controls which bits corresponding to PIOm_n are active in the MPORT register (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = Read MPORT: pin state; write MPORT: load output bit. 1 = Read MPORT: 0; write MPORT: output bit not affected.

field.name: PORT0
field.description: Reads pin states or loads output bits (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = Read: pin is low; write: clear output bit. 1 = Read: pin is high; write: set output bit.

field.name: MPORTP0

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: DMA controller master enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The DMA controller is disabled. This clears any triggers that were asserted at the point when disabled, but does not prevent re-triggering when the DMA controller is re-enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The DMA controller is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: ACTIVEINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one enabled interrupt is pending.

field.name: ACTIVEERRINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one error interrupt is pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: SRAMBASE
register.description: SRAM address of the channel configuration table.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Address of the beginning of the DMA descriptor table. The table must begin on a 1 kB boundary. Boundary needed for 18 channel DMA configuration: 512 bytes (bottom 9 bits = 0)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: PERIPHREQEN
field.description: Peripheral request Enable. If a DMA channel is used to perform a memory-to-memory move, any peripheral DMA request associated with that channel can be disabled to prevent any interaction between the peripheral and the DMA controller.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Peripheral DMA requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Peripheral DMA requests are enabled.

field.name: HWTRIGEN
field.description: Hardware Triggering Enable for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Hardware triggering is not used.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TRIGPOL
field.description: Trigger Polarity. Selects the polarity of a hardware trigger for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_LOW__FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Active low - falling edge. Hardware trigger is active low or falling edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_HIGH__RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Active high - rising edge. Hardware trigger is active high or rising edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

field.name: TRIGTYPE
field.description: Trigger Type. Selects hardware trigger as edge triggered or level triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Edge. Hardware trigger is edge triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Level. Hardware trigger is level triggered. Note that when level triggering without burst (BURSTPOWER = 0) is selected, only hardware triggers should be used on that channel.

field.name: TRIGBURST
field.description: Trigger Burst. Selects whether hardware triggers cause a single or burst transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE_TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Single transfer. Hardware trigger causes a single transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BURST_TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Burst transfer. When the trigger for this channel is set to edge triggered, a hardware trigger causes a burst transfer, as defined by BURSTPOWER. When the trigger for this channel is set to level triggered, a hardware trigger causes transfers to continue as long as the trigger is asserted, unless the transfer is complete.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: BURSTPOWER
field.description: Burst Power is used in two ways. It always selects the address wrap size when SrcBurstWrap and/or DstBurstWrap is modes are selected (see descriptions elsewhere in this register). When the TRIGBURST field elsewhere in this register = 1, Burst Power selects how many transfers are performed for each DMA trigger. This can be used, for example, with peripherals that contain a FIFO that can initiate a DMA operation when the FIFO reaches a certain level. 0000: Burst size = 1 (20). 0001: Burst size = 2 (21). 0010: Burst size = 4 (22). ... 1010: Burst size = 1024 (210). This corresponds to the maximum supported transfer count. others: not supported.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SRCBURSTWRAP
field.description: Source Burst Wrap. When enabled, the source data address for the DMA is wrapped, meaning that the source address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to read several sequential registers from a peripheral for each DMA burst, reading the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Source burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Source burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: DSTBURSTWRAP
field.description: Destination Burst Wrap. When enabled, the destination data address for the DMA is wrapped, meaning that the destination address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to write several sequential registers to a peripheral for each DMA burst, writing the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Destination burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Destination burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: CHPRIORITY
field.description: Priority of this channel when multiple DMA requests are pending. This description reflects a 3-bit priority field giving 8 priority levels. A specific instance of the SDMA might have anywhere from 2 to 16 priority levels (1 to 4 bits for the CH_PRIORITY field). 0x0 = highest priority. 0x7 = lowest priority.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTLSTAT%s
register.description: Control and status register for DMA channel 0.

field.name: VALIDPENDING
field.description: Valid pending flag for this channel. This bit is set when a 1 is written to the corresponding bit in the related SETVALID register when CFGVALID = 1 for the same channel.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Trigger flag. Indicates that the trigger for this channel is currently set. This bit is cleared at the end of an entire transfer or upon reload when CLRTRIG = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Not triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is not set. DMA operations will not be carried out.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is set. DMA operations will be carried out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: XFERCFG%s
register.description: Transfer configuration register for DMA channel 0.

field.name: CFGVALID
field.description: Configuration Valid flag. This bit indicates whether the current channel descriptor is valid and can potentially be acted upon, if all other activation criteria are fulfilled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Not valid. The current channel descriptor is not considered valid.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Valid. The current channel descriptor is considered valid.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Indicates whether the channel's control structure will be reloaded when the current descriptor is exhausted. Reloading allows ping-pong and linked transfers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Do not reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SWTRIG
field.description: Software Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: WHEN_WRITTEN_BY_SOFT
enumeratedValue.description: When written by software, the trigger for this channel is not set. A new trigger, as defined by the HWTRIGEN, TRIGPOL, and TRIGTYPE will be needed to start the channel.

enumeratedValue.name: WHEN_WRITTEN_BY_SOFT
enumeratedValue.description: When written by software, the trigger for this channel is set immediately. This feature should not be used with level triggering when TRIGBURST = 0.

field.name: CLRTRIG
field.description: Clear Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Not cleared. The trigger is not cleared when this descriptor is exhausted. If there is a reload, the next descriptor will be started.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Cleared. The trigger is cleared when this descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTA
field.description: Set Interrupt flag A for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTA flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTB
field.description: Set Interrupt flag B for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTB flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: WIDTH
field.description: Transfer width used for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BIT_TRANSFERS_ARE
enumeratedValue.description: 8-bit transfers are performed (8-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: 16_BIT_TRANSFERS_ARE
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit transfers are performed (16-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: 32_BIT_TRANSFERS_ARE
enumeratedValue.description: 32-bit transfers are performed (32-bit source reads and destination writes).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SRCINC
field.description: Determines whether the source address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The source address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The source address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The source address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: 4_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The source address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: DSTINC
field.description: Determines whether the destination address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The destination address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The destination address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The destination address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: 4_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The destination address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: XFERCOUNT
field.description: Total number of transfers to be performed, minus 1 encoded. The number of bytes transferred is: (XFERCOUNT + 1) x data width (as defined by the WIDTH field). 0x0 = a total of 1 transfer will be performed. 0x1 = a total of 2 transfers will be performed. ... 0x3FF = a total of 1,024 transfers will be performed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DEV_ADDR
field.description: USB device address. After bus reset, the address is reset to 0x00. If the enable bit is set, the device will respond on packets for function address DEV_ADDR. When receiving a SetAddress Control Request from the USB host, software must program the new address before completing the status phase of the SetAddress Control Request.

field.name: DEV_EN
field.description: USB device enable. If this bit is set, the HW will start responding on packets for function address DEV_ADDR.

field.name: SETUP
field.description: SETUP token received. If a SETUP token is received and acknowledged by the device, this bit is set. As long as this bit is set all received IN and OUT tokens will be NAKed by HW. SW must clear this bit by writing a one. If this bit is zero, HW will handle the tokens to the CTRL EP0 as indicated by the CTRL EP0 IN and OUT data information programmed by SW.

field.name: PLL_ON
field.description: USB Clock/PLL control.

enumeratedValue.name: USB_NEEDCLK_ALWAYS_1
enumeratedValue.description: USB_NeedClk always 1. Clock will not be stopped in case of suspend.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: LPM_SUP
field.description: LPM Support.

field.name: INTONNAK_AO
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk OUT EP

enumeratedValue.name: ONLY_ACKNOWLEDGED_PA
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH_ACKNOWLEDGED_AN
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: INTONNAK_AI
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk IN EP

enumeratedValue.name: ONLY_ACKNOWLEDGED_PA
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH_ACKNOWLEDGED_AN
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: INTONNAK_CO
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for control OUT EP

enumeratedValue.name: ONLY_ACKNOWLEDGED_PA
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH_ACKNOWLEDGED_AN
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: INTONNAK_CI
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for control IN EP

enumeratedValue.name: ONLY_ACKNOWLEDGED_PA
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH_ACKNOWLEDGED_AN
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: DCON
field.description: Device status - connect. The connect bit must be set by SW to indicate that the device must signal a connect. The pull-up resistor on USB_DP will be enabled when this bit is set and the VbusDebounced bit is one.

field.name: DSUS
field.description: Device status - suspend. The suspend bit indicates the current suspend state. It is set to 1 when the device hasn't seen any activity on its upstream port for more than 3 milliseconds. It is reset to 0 on any activity. When the device is suspended (Suspend bit DSUS = 1) and the software writes a 0 to it, the device will generate a remote wake-up. This will only happen when the device is connected (Connect bit = 1). When the device is not connected or not suspended, a writing a 0 has no effect. Writing a 1 never has an effect.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: LPM_SUS
field.description: Device status - LPM Suspend. This bit represents the current LPM suspend state. It is set to 1 by HW when the device has acknowledged the LPM request from the USB host and the Token Retry Time of 10us has elapsed. When the device is in the LPM suspended state (LPM suspend bit = 1) and the software writes a zero to this bit, the device will generate a remote walk-up. Software can only write a zero to this bit when the LPM_REWP bit is set to 1. HW resets this bit when it receives a host initiated resume. HW only updates the LPM_SUS bit when the LPM_SUPP bit is equal to one.

field.name: LPM_REWP
field.description: LPM Remote Wake-up Enabled by USB host. HW sets this bit to one when the bRemoteWake bit in the LPM extended token is set to 1. HW will reset this bit to 0 when it receives the host initiated LPM resume, when a remote wake-up is sent by the device or when a USB bus reset is received. Software can use this bit to check if the remote wake-up feature is enabled by the host for the LPM transaction.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: DCON_C
field.description: Device status - connect change. The Connect Change bit is set when the device's pull-up resistor is disconnected because VBus disappeared. The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

field.name: DSUS_C
field.description: Device status - suspend change. The suspend change bit is set to 1 when the suspend bit toggles. The suspend bit can toggle because: - The device goes in the suspended state - The device is disconnected - The device receives resume signaling on its upstream port. The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

field.name: DRES_C
field.description: Device status - reset change. This bit is set when the device received a bus reset. On a bus reset the device will automatically go to the default state (unconfigured and responding to address 0). The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: VBUSDEBOUNCED
field.description: This bit indicates if Vbus is detected or not. The bit raises immediately when Vbus becomes high. It drops to zero if Vbus is low for at least 3 ms. If this bit is high and the DCon bit is set, the HW will enable the pull-up resistor to signal a connect.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: FRAME_NR
field.description: Frame number. This contains the frame number of the last successfully received SOF. In case no SOF was received by the device at the beginning of a frame, the frame number returned is that of the last successfully received SOF. In case the SOF frame number contained a CRC error, the frame number returned will be the corrupted frame number as received by the device.

field.name: ERR_CODE
field.description: The error code which last occurred:

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: EPLISTSTART
register.description: USB EP Command/Status List start address

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EP_LIST
field.description: Start address of the USB EP Command/Status List.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DA_BUF
field.description: Start address of the buffer pointer page where all endpoint data buffers are located.

field.name: HIRD_HW
field.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - HW. This is the HIRD value from the last received LPM token

field.name: HIRD_SW
field.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - SW. This is the time duration required by the USB device system to come out of LPM initiated suspend after receiving the host initiated LPM resume.

field.name: DATA_PENDING
field.description: As long as this bit is set to one and LPM supported bit is set to one, HW will return a NYET handshake on every LPM token it receives. If LPM supported bit is set to one and this bit is zero, HW will return an ACK handshake on every LPM token it receives. If SW has still data pending and LPM is supported, it must set this bit to 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SKIP
field.description: Endpoint skip: Writing 1 to one of these bits, will indicate to HW that it must deactivate the buffer assigned to this endpoint and return control back to software. When HW has deactivated the endpoint, it will clear this bit, but it will not modify the EPINUSE bit. An interrupt will be generated when the Active bit goes from 1 to 0. Note: In case of double-buffering, HW will only clear the Active bit of the buffer indicated by the EPINUSE bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Fixed to zero because the control endpoint zero is fixed to single-buffering for each physical endpoint.

field.name: BUF
field.description: Buffer in use: This register has one bit per physical endpoint. 0: HW is accessing buffer 0. 1: HW is accessing buffer 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Fixed to zero because the control endpoint zero is fixed to single-buffering for each physical endpoint.

field.name: BUF_SB
field.description: Buffer usage: This register has one bit per physical endpoint. 0: Single-buffer. 1: Double-buffer. If the bit is set to single-buffer (0), it will not toggle the corresponding EPINUSE bit when it clears the active bit. If the bit is set to double-buffer (1), HW will toggle the EPINUSE bit when it clears the Active bit for the buffer.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EP0OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 OUT direction. This bit will be set if NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software or a SETUP packet is successfully received for the control EP0. If the IntOnNAK_CO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the Control EP0 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP0IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 IN direction. This bit will be set if NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_CI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the Control EP0 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP1OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP1 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP1IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP1 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP2OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP2 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP2IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP2 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP3OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP3 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP3IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP3 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP4OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP4 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP4IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP4 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRAME_INT
field.description: Frame interrupt. This bit is set to one every millisecond when the VbusDebounced bit and the DCON bit are set. This bit can be used by software when handling isochronous endpoints. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: DEV_INT
field.description: Device status interrupt. This bit is set by HW when one of the bits in the Device Status Change register are set. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRAME_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

field.name: DEV_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

field.name: EP_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRAME_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

field.name: DEV_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

field.name: ROUTE_INT9_0
field.description: This bit can control on which hardware interrupt line the interrupt will be generated: 0: IRQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit 1: FIQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ROUTE_INT30
field.description: This bit can control on which hardware interrupt line the interrupt will be generated: 0: IRQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit 1: FIQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit

field.name: ROUTE_INT31
field.description: This bit can control on which hardware interrupt line the interrupt will be generated: 0: IRQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit 1: FIQ interrupt line is selected for this interrupt bit

field.name: TOGGLE
field.description: Endpoint data toggle: This field indicates the current value of the data toggle for the corresponding endpoint.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CRC_POLY
field.description: CRC polynom: 1X= CRC-32 polynomial 01= CRC-16 polynomial 00= CRC-CCITT polynomial

field.name: BIT_RVS_WR
field.description: Data bit order: 1= Bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte) 0= No bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

field.name: CMPL_WR
field.description: Data complement: 1= 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA 0= No 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA

field.name: BIT_RVS_SUM
field.description: CRC sum bit order: 1= Bit order reverse for CRC_SUM 0= No bit order reverse for CRC_SUM

field.name: CMPL_SUM
field.description: CRC sum complement: 1= 1's complement for CRC_SUM 0=No 1's complement for CRC_SUM

field.name: Reserved
field.description: Always 0 when read

field.name: CRC_SEED
field.description: A write access to this register will load CRC seed value to CRC_SUM register with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-processes. A write access to this register will overrule the CRC calculation in progresses.

field.name: CRC_SUM
field.description: The most recent CRC sum can be read through this register with selected bit order and 1's complement post-processes.

field.name: CRC_WR_DATA
field.description: Data written to this register will be taken to perform CRC calculation with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-process. Any write size 8, 16 or 32-bit are allowed and accept back-to-back transactions.

field.name: UNIFY
field.description: SCT operation

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_OPERATES_AS
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as two 16-bit counters named L and H.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_OPERATES_AS
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as a unified 32-bit counter.

field.name: CLKMODE
field.description: SCT clock mode

enumeratedValue.name: SYSTEM_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: System clock. The system clock clocks the SCT and prescalers.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALED_SYSTEM_CLO
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaled system clock. The SCT clock is the system clock, but the prescalers are enabled to count only when sampling of the input selected by the CKSEL field finds the selected edge. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the high-performance sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SCT_INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: SCT input. The input selected by CLKSEL clocks the SCT and prescalers. The input is synchronized to the bus clock and possibly inverted. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the low-power sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALED_SCT_INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaled SCT input. The SCT and prescalers are clocked by the input edge selected by the CLKSEL field. In this mode, most of the SCT is clocked by the (selected polarity of the) input. The outputs are switched synchronously to the input clock. The input clock rate must be at least half the system clock rate and can the same or faster than the system clock.

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: SCT clock select

field.name: NORELAOD_L
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the lower match and fractional match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: NORELOAD_H
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the higher match and fractional match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: INSYNC
field.description: Synchronization for input n (bit 9 = input 0, bit 10 = input 1,..., bit 16 = input 7). A 1 in one of these bits subjects the corresponding input to synchronization to the SCT clock, before it is used to create an event. If an input is synchronous to the SCT clock, keep its bit 0 for faster response. When the CKMODE field is 1x, the bit in this field, corresponding to the input selected by the CKSEL field, is not used.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_L
field.description: A one in this bit causes a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in uni-directional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_H
field.description: A one in this bit will cause a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in uni-directional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DOWN_L
field.description: This bit is 1 when the L or unified counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter limit is reached and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter reaches 0 or when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs.

field.name: STOP_L
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the L or unified counter does not run but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_L
field.description: When this bit is 1, the L or unified counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_L bit is one, the STOP_L bit is cleared. If you want to remove the halt condition and keep the SCT in the stop condition (not running), then you can change the halt and stop condition with one single write to this register. Once set, only software can clear this bit to restore counter operation.

field.name: CLRCTR_L
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the L or unified counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_L
field.description: L or unified counter direction select

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_COUNTS_U
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_COUNTS_U
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_L
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the L or unified counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRE_L+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DOWN_H
field.description: This bit is 1 when the H counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter limit is reached and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter reaches 0 or when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs.

field.name: STOP_H
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the H counter does not run but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_H
field.description: When this bit is 1, the H counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_H bit is one, the STOP_H bit is cleared. If you want to remove the halt condition and keep the SCT in the stop condition (not running), then you can change the halt and stop condition with one single write to this register. Once set, this bit can only be cleared by software to restore counter operation.

field.name: CLRCTR_H
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the H counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_H
field.description: Direction select

enumeratedValue.name: THE_H_COUNTER_COUNTS
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_H_COUNTER_COUNTS
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_H
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the H counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRELH+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: LIMMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit event for the L or unified counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: LIMMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit event for the H counter (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: HALTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: HALTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: STOPMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: STOPMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: STARTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: STARTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: DITHMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, the event n causes the dither engine to advance to the next element in the dither pattern at the start of the next counter cycle of the 16-bit low counter or the unified counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15). If all bits are set to 0, the dither pattern automatically advances at the start of every new counter cycle.

field.name: DITHMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, the event n causes the dither engine to advance to the next element in the dither pattern at the start of the next counter cycle of the 16-bit high counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15). If all bits are set to 0, the dither pattern automatically advances at the start of every new counter cycle.

field.name: CTR_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit L counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: CTR_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit H counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: STATE_L
field.description: State variable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: STATE_H
field.description: State variable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: AIN0
field.description: Real-time status of input 0.

field.name: AIN1
field.description: Real-time status of input 1.

field.name: AIN2
field.description: Real-time status of input 2.

field.name: AIN3
field.description: Real-time status of input 3.

field.name: AIN4
field.description: Real-time status of input 4.

field.name: AIN5
field.description: Real-time status of input 5.

field.name: AIN6
field.description: Real-time status of input 6.

field.name: AIN7
field.description: Real-time status of input 7.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: SIN0
field.description: Input 0 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN1
field.description: Input 1 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN2
field.description: Input 2 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN3
field.description: Input 3 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN4
field.description: Input 4 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN5
field.description: Input 5 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN6
field.description: Input 6 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN7
field.description: Input 7 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: REGMOD_L
field.description: Each bit controls one pair of match/capture registers (register 0 = bit 0, register 1 = bit 1,..., register 15 = bit 15). 0 = registers operate as match registers. 1 = registers operate as capture registers.

field.name: REGMOD_H
field.description: Each bit controls one pair of match/capture registers (register 0 = bit 16, register 1 = bit 17,..., register 15 = bit 31). 0 = registers operate as match registers. 1 = registers operate as capture registers.

field.name: OUT
field.description: Writing a 1 to bit n makes the corresponding output HIGH. 0 makes the corresponding output LOW (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 9 = bit 9).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: OUTPUTDIRCTRL
register.description: SCT output counter direction control register

field.name: SETCLR0
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 0. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR1
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 1. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR2
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 2. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR3
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 3. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR4
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 4. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: DEV_0
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets DMA request 0 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DRL0
field.description: A 1 in this bit makes the SCT set DMA request 0 when it loads the Match_L/Unified registers from the Reload_L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ0
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 0

field.name: DEV_1
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets DMA request 1 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DRL1
field.description: A 1 in this bit makes the SCT set DMA request 1 when it loads the Match L/Unified registers from the Reload L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ1
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 1.

field.name: IEN
field.description: The SCT requests interrupt when bit n of this register and the event flag register are both one (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if event n has occurred since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: NCEN
field.description: The SCT requests interrupt when bit n of this register and the SCT conflict flag register are both one (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 9 = bit 9).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: NCFLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if a no-change conflict event occurred on output n since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 9 = bit 9).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: BUSERRL
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR L/Unified, STATE L/Unified, MATCH L/Unified, or the Output register when the L/U counter was not halted. A word write to certain L and H registers can be half successful and half unsuccessful.

field.name: BUSERRH
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR H, STATE H, MATCH H, or the Output register when the H counter was not halted.

register.name: MATCH%s
register.description: SCT match value register of match channels 0 to 15; REGMOD0 to REGMODE15 = 0

field.name: MATCHn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the L counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

field.name: MATCHn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the H counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

register.name: FRACMAT%s
register.description: Fractional match registers 0 to 5 for SCT match value registers 0 to 5.

field.name: FRACMAT_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 4-bit value specifying the dither pattern to be applied to the corresponding MATCHn_L register (n = 0 to 5). When UNIFY = 1, the value applies to the unified, 32-bit fractional match register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: FRACMAT_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write 4-bit value specifying the dither pattern to be applied to the corresponding MATCHn_H register (n = 0 to 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CAP%s
register.description: SCT capture register of capture channel 0 to 15; REGMOD0 to REGMODE15 = 1

field.name: CAPn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

field.name: CAPn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

register.name: MATCHREL%s
register.description: SCT match reload value register 0 to 15; REGMOD0 = 0 to REGMODE15 = 0

field.name: RELOADn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: RELOADn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

register.name: FRACMATREL%s
register.description: Fractional match reload registers 0 to 5 for SCT match value registers 0 to 5.

field.name: RELFRAC_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 4-bit value to be loaded into the FRACMATn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 4 bits to be loaded into the FRACMATn register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RELFRAC_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 4-bit value to be loaded into the FRACMATn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 4 bits with the 4-bit value to be loaded into the FRACMATn register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CAPCTRL%s
register.description: SCT capture control register 0 to 15; REGMOD0 = 1 to REGMODE15 = 1

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17,..., event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: STATEMSKn
field.description: If bit m is one, event n (n= 0 to 15) happens in state m of the counter selected by the HEVENT bit (m = state number; state 0 = bit 0, state 1= bit 1,..., state 31 = bit 31).

field.name: MATCHSEL
field.description: Selects the Match register associated with this event (if any). A match can occur only when the counter selected by the HEVENT bit is running.

field.name: HEVENT
field.description: Select L/H counter. Do not set this bit if UNIFY = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_L_STATE
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the L state and the L match register selected by MATCHSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_H_STATE
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the H state and the H match register selected by MATCHSEL.

field.name: OUTSEL
field.description: Input/output select

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_INPUT_SE
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the input selected by IOSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_OUTPUT_S
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the output selected by IOSEL.

field.name: IOSEL
field.description: Selects the input or output signal associated with this event (if any). Do not select an input in this register, if CKMODE is 1x. In this case the clock input is an implicit ingredient of every event.

field.name: IOCOND
field.description: Selects the I/O condition for event n. (The detection of edges on outputs lags the conditions that switch the outputs by one SCT clock). In order to guarantee proper edge/state detection, an input must have a minimum pulse width of at least one SCT clock period .

field.name: COMBMODE
field.description: Selects how the specified match and I/O condition are used and combined.

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: OR. The event occurs when either the specified match or I/O condition occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: MATCH. Uses the specified match only.

enumeratedValue.name: IO
enumeratedValue.description: IO. Uses the specified I/O condition only.

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: AND. The event occurs when the specified match and I/O condition occur simultaneously.

field.name: STATELD
field.description: This bit controls how the STATEV value modifies the state selected by HEVENT when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state.

enumeratedValue.name: STATEV_VALUE_IS_ADDE
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is added into STATE (the carry-out is ignored).

enumeratedValue.name: STATEV_VALUE_IS_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is loaded into STATE.

field.name: STATEV
field.description: This value is loaded into or added to the state selected by HEVENT, depending on STATELD, when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state. If STATELD and STATEV are both zero, there is no change to the STATE value.

field.name: MATCHMEM
field.description: If this bit is one and the COMBMODE field specifies a match component to the triggering of this event, then a match is considered to be active whenever the counter value is GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the value specified in the match register when counting up, LESS THEN OR EQUAL TO the match value when counting down. If this bit is zero, a match is only be active during the cycle when the counter is equal to the match value.

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: Direction qualifier for event generation. This field only applies when the counters are operating in BIDIR mode. If BIDIR = 0, the SCT ignores this field. Value 0x3 is reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: DIRECTION_INDEPENDEN
enumeratedValue.description: Direction independent. This event is triggered regardless of the count direction.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_UP
enumeratedValue.description: Counting up. This event is triggered only during up-counting when BIDIR = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Counting down. This event is triggered only during down-counting when BIDIR = 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SET
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to set output n (or clear it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CLR
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to clear output n (or set it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 15 = bit 15.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: UNIFY
field.description: SCT operation

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_OPERATES_AS
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as two 16-bit counters named L and H.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_OPERATES_AS
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as a unified 32-bit counter.

field.name: CLKMODE
field.description: SCT clock mode

enumeratedValue.name: THE_BUS_CLOCK_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: The bus clock clocks the SCT and prescalers.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_CLOCK_IS_THE
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT clock is the bus clock, but the prescalers are enabled to count only when sampling of the input selected by the CKSEL field finds the selected edge. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the high-performance sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_INPUT_SELECTED_B
enumeratedValue.description: The input selected by CKSEL clocks the SCT and prescalers. The input is synchronized to the bus clock and possibly inverted. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the low-power sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved.This is not reserved on the LPC15xx. Need to add back in from spec.

field.name: CKSEL
field.description: SCT clock select

field.name: NORELAOD_L
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the lower match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: NORELOAD_H
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the higher match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: INSYNC
field.description: Synchronization for input N (bit 9 = input 0, bit 10 = input 1,..., bit 16 = input 7). A 1 in one of these bits subjects the corresponding input to synchronization to the SCT clock, before it is used to create an event. If an input is synchronous to the SCT clock, keep its bit 0 for faster response. When the CKMODE field is 1x, the bit in this field, corresponding to the input selected by the CKSEL field, is not used.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_L
field.description: A one in this bit causes a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in uni-directional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_H
field.description: A one in this bit will cause a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in uni-directional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DOWN_L
field.description: This bit is 1 when the L or unified counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter limit is reached and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_L
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the L or unified counter does not run, but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_L
field.description: When this bit is 1, the L or unified counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_L bit is one, the STOP_L bit is cleared. If you want to remove the halt condition and keep the SCT in the stop condition (not running), then you can change the halt and stop condition with one single write to this register. Once set, only software can clear this bit to restore counter operation.

field.name: CLRCTR_L
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the L or unified counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_L
field.description: L or unified counter direction select

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_COUNTS_U
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_COUNTS_U
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_L
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the L or unified counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRE_L+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DOWN_H
field.description: This bit is 1 when the H counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter limit is reached and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_H
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the H counter does not, run but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_H
field.description: When this bit is 1, the H counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_H bit is one, the STOP_H bit is cleared. If you want to remove the halt condition and keep the SCT in the stop condition (not running), then you can change the halt and stop condition with one single write to this register. Once set, this bit can only be cleared by software to restore counter operation.

field.name: CLRCTR_H
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the H counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_H
field.description: Direction select

enumeratedValue.name: THE_H_COUNTER_COUNTS
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_H_COUNTER_COUNTS
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_H
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the H counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRELH+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: LIMMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the L or unified counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: LIMMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the H counter (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: HALTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: HALTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: STOPMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: STOPMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: STARTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 15 = bit 15).

field.name: STARTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 15 = bit 31).

field.name: CTR_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit L counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: CTR_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit H counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: STATE_L
field.description: State variable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: STATE_H
field.description: State variable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: AIN0
field.description: Real-time status of input 0.

field.name: AIN1
field.description: Real-time status of input 1.

field.name: AIN2
field.description: Real-time status of input 2.

field.name: AIN3
field.description: Real-time status of input 3.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: SIN0
field.description: Input 0 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN1
field.description: Input 1 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN2
field.description: Input 2 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN3
field.description: Input 3 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: REGMOD_L
field.description: Each bit controls one pair of match/capture registers (register 0 = bit 0, register 1 = bit 1,..., register 15 = bit 15). 0 = registers operate as match registers. 1 = registers operate as capture registers.

field.name: REGMOD_H
field.description: Each bit controls one pair of match/capture registers (register 0 = bit 16, register 1 = bit 17,..., register 15 = bit 31). 0 = registers operate as match registers. 1 = registers operate as capture registers.

field.name: OUT
field.description: Writing a 1 to bit n makes the corresponding output HIGH. 0 makes the corresponding output LOW (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: OUTPUTDIRCTRL
register.description: SCT output counter direction control register

field.name: SETCLR0
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 0. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.
