field.description: SCT1_OUT3 pin enable.

field.name: SCT1_OUT4
field.description: SCT1_OUT4 pin enable.

field.name: SCT1_OUT5
field.description: SCT1_OUT5 pin enable.

field.name: SCT1_OUT6
field.description: SCT1_OUT6 pin enable.

field.name: SCT1_OUT7
field.description: SCT1_OUT7 pin enable.

field.name: SCT2_OUT3
field.description: SCT2_OUT3 pin enable.

field.name: SCT2_OUT4
field.description: SCT2_OUT4 pin enable.

field.name: SCT2_OUT5
field.description: SCT2_OUT5 pin enable.

field.name: SCT3_OUT3
field.description: SCT3_OUT3 pin enable.

field.name: SCT3_OUT4
field.description: SCT3_OUT4 pin enable.

field.name: SCT3_OUT5
field.description: SCT3_OUT5 pin enable.

field.name: RESETN
field.description: RESETN pin enable.

field.name: SWCLK_TCK
field.description: SWCLK_TCK pin enable.

field.name: SWDIO
field.description: SWDIO pin enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: NODPD
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents entry to Deep power-down mode. This bit is cleared by power-on reset.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

field.name: SLEEPFLAG
field.description: Sleep mode flag

enumeratedValue.name: READ_NO_POWER_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Read: No power-down mode entered. The part is in Active mode. Write: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEP_DEEP_SLEEP
enumeratedValue.description: Read: Sleep/Deep-sleep or Deep power-down mode entered. Write: Writing a 1 clears the SLEEPFLAG bit to 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

field.name: DPDFLAG
field.description: Deep power-down flag

enumeratedValue.name: READ_DEEP_POWER_DOW
enumeratedValue.description: Read: Deep power-down mode not entered. Write: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: READ_DEEP_POWER_DOW
enumeratedValue.description: Read: Deep power-down mode entered. Write: Clear the Deep power-down flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

field.name: GPDATA
field.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

field.name: WAKEUPHYS
field.description: WAKEUP pin hysteresis enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Hysteresis for WAKEUP pin disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Hysteresis for WAKEUP pin enabled.

field.name: WAKEPAD_DISABLE
field.description: WAKEUP pin disable. Setting this bit disables the wake-up pin, so it can be used for other purposes. Never set this bit if you intend to use a pin to wake up the part from Deep power-down mode. You can only disable the wake-up pin if the self wake-up timer is enabled and configured. Setting this bit is not necessary if Deep power-down mode is not used.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The wake-up function is enabled on pin PIO0_4.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Setting this bit disables the wake-up function on pin PIO0_4.

field.name: LPOSCEN
field.description: Enable the low-power oscillator for use with the 10 kHz self wake-up timer clock. You must set this bit if the CLKSEL bit in the self wake-up timer CTRL bit is set. Do not enable the low-power oscillator if the self wake-up timer is clocked by the divided IRC.

field.name: LPOSCDPDEN
field.description: Enable the low-power oscillator in Deep power-down mode. Setting this bit causes the low-power oscillator to remain running during Deep power-down mode provided that bit 2 in this register is set as well. You must set this bit for the self wake-up timer to be able to wake up the part from Deep power-down mode. Do not set this bit unless you use the self wake-up timer to wake up from Deep power-down mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: USART Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. For instance, when re-enabled, the USART will immediately generate a TxRdy interrupt (if enabled in the INTENSET register) or a DMA transfer request because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register.

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd.

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only write 0 to this bit.

field.name: MODE32K
field.description: Selects standard or 32 kHz clocking mode.

enumeratedValue.name: UART_USES_THE_32_KHZ
enumeratedValue.description: UART uses the 32 kHz clock from the RTC oscillator as the clock source to the BRG, and uses a special bit clocking scheme.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled. See Section 24.7.4 for more information.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLOW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal.

enumeratedValue.name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SYNCEN
field.description: Selects synchronous or asynchronous operation.

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SYNCMST
field.description: Synchronous mode Master select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Selects data loopback mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for one character time after the end of the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted.

field.name: AUTOADDR
field.description: Automatic Address matching enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match.

field.name: OESEL
field.description: Output Enable Select.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function.

enumeratedValue.name: RS_485
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485. The RTS signal configured to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver.

field.name: OEPOL
field.description: Output Enable Polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high.

field.name: RXPOL
field.description: Receive data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the UART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: TXPOL
field.description: Transmit data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the UART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXBRKEN
field.description: Break Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_BREAK_IS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN.

field.name: ADDRDET
field.description: Enable address detect mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXDIS
field.description: Transmit Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD).

field.name: CLRCCONRX
field.description: Clear Continuous Clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_AFFECT_ON_THE_CC
enumeratedValue.description: No affect on the CC bit.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: AUTOBAUD
field.description: Autobaud enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. UART is in normal operating mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. UART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the UART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT or RXDATSTAT registers.

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT. Set when the data is moved from the transmit buffer to the transmit shift register.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software.

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Status flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the UART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS bit in the CFG register (TXDIS = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a new character is received while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the newly received character in the shift register is lost.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs. Cleared by software.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character..

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Auto baud Error. An auto baud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an auto baud time-out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register. Contains an individual interrupt enable bit for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a received character available to be read from the RXDAT register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the TXDAT register is available to take another character to transmit.

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input.

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an overrun error occurred.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted).

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected.

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected.

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected.

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected. See description of the RXNOISEINT bit in Table 322.

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an auto baud error occurs.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXDISCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: Receiver Data register. Contains the last character received.

field.name: DATA
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RXDATSTAT
register.description: Receiver Data with Status register. Combines the last character received with the current USART receive status. Allows DMA or software to recover incoming data and status together.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag. See description of the RxNoiseInt bit in Table 322.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: Transmit Data register. Data to be transmitted is written here.

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and any conditions for transmitting data are met: CTS low (if CTSEN bit = 1), TXDIS bit = 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only zero should be written.

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value.

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = The FRG clock is used directly by the USART function. 1 = The FRG clock is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = The FRG clock is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. ... 0xFFFF = The FRG clock is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected.

field.name: TXDISINT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag.

field.name: ABERRINT
field.description: Auto baud Error Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication.

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. ... 0xF= 16 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: SPI enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SPI is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SPI is enabled for operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MASTER
field.description: Master mode select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode. The SPI will operate in slave mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are inputs, MISO is an output.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Master mode. The SPI will operate in master mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are outputs, MISO is an input.

field.name: LSBF
field.description: LSB First mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. Data is transmitted and received in standard MSB first order.

enumeratedValue.name: REVERSE
enumeratedValue.description: Reverse. Data is transmitted and received in reverse order (LSB first).

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock Phase select.

enumeratedValue.name: CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: Change. The SPI captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is changed on the following edge.

enumeratedValue.name: CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: Capture. The SPI changes serial data on the first clock transition of the frame (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is captured on the following edge.

field.name: CPOL
field.description: Clock Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The rest state of the clock (between frames) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The rest state of the clock (between frames) is high.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Loopback mode enable. Loopback mode applies only to Master mode, and connects transmit and receive data connected together to allow simple software testing.

field.name: SPOL0
field.description: SSEL0 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL0 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL0 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL0 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL0 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL0 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL0 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: SPOL1
field.description: SSEL1 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL1 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL1 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL1 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL1 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL1 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL1 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: SPOL2
field.description: SSEL2 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL2 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL2 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL2 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL2 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL2 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL2 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: SPOL3
field.description: SSEL3 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL3 pin is active low. The value in the SSEL3 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL3 is not inverted relative to the pins.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL3 pin is active high. The value in the SSEL3 fields of the RXDAT, TXDATCTL, and TXCTL registers related to SSEL3 is inverted relative to the pins.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: PRE_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between SSEL assertion and the beginning of a data frame. There is always one SPI clock time between SSEL assertion and the first clock edge. This is not considered part of the pre-delay. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. ... 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: POST_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between the end of a data frame and SSEL deassertion. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. ... 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: FRAME_DELAY
field.description: Controls the minimum amount of time between adjacent data frames. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. ... 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: TRANSFER_DELAY
field.description: Controls the minimum amount of time that the SSEL is deasserted between transfers. 0x0 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 1 SPI clock time. (Zero added time.) 0x1 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 2 SPI clock times. 0x2 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 3 SPI clock times. ... 0xF = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 16 SPI clock times.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: SPI Status. Some status flags can be cleared by writing a 1 to that bit position

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT or TXDATCTL until the data is moved to the transmit shift register.

field.name: RXOV
field.description: Receiver Overrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). This flag is set when the beginning of a received character is detected while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the receiver buffer contents are preserved, and the incoming data is lost. Data received by the SPI should be considered undefined if RxOv is set.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). In this case, the transmitter must begin sending new data on the next input clock if the transmitter is idle. If that data is not available in the transmitter holding register at that point, there is no data to transmit and the TXUR flag is set. Data transmitted by the SPI should be considered undefined if TXUR is set.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert. This flag is set whenever any slave select transitions from deasserted to asserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become busy, and allows waking up the device from reduced power modes when a slave mode access begins. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert. This flag is set whenever any asserted slave selects transition to deasserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become idle. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: STALLED
field.description: Stalled status flag. This indicates whether the SPI is currently in a stall condition.

field.name: ENDTRANSFER
field.description: End Transfer control bit. Software can set this bit to force an end to the current transfer when the transmitter finishes any activity already in progress, as if the EOT flag had been set prior to the last transmission. This capability is included to support cases where it is not known when transmit data is written that it will be the end of a transfer. The bit is cleared when the transmitter becomes Idle as the transfer comes to an end. Forcing an end of transfer in this manner causes any specified FrameDelay and TransferDelay to be inserted.

field.name: IDLE
field.description: Idle status flag. This bit is 1 whenever the SPI master function is fully idle. This means that the transmit holding register is empty and the transmitter is not in the process of sending data.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable read and Set. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: AN_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available in the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: AN_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when data may be written to TXDAT.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receiver overrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need for the receiver to move newly received data to the RXDAT register when it is already in use. The interface prevents receiver overrun in Master mode by not allowing a new transmission to begin when a receiver overrun would otherwise occur.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when a receiver overrun occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: AN_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated if a receiver overrun occurs.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmitter underrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need to transmit data when none is available.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter underruns.

enumeratedValue.name: AN_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated if the transmitter underruns.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: AN_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: AN_INTERRUPT_WILL_BE
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit in INTENSET to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: Receiver Data. This contains the next piece of received data. The number of bits that are used depends on the FLen setting in TXCTL / TXDATCTL.

field.name: RXSSEL0
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL0 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL0 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL1
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL1 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL1 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL2
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL2 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL2 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL3
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL3 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL3 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of Transfer flag. This flag will be 1 if this is the first frame after the SSELs went from deasserted to asserted (i.e., any previous transfer has ended). This information can be used to identify the first piece of data in cases where the frame length is greater than 16 bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 1 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: TXSSEL0
field.description: Transmit Slave Select . This field controls what is output for SSEL0 in master mode. The active state of the SSEL0 function is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL1
field.description: Transmit Slave Select . This field controls what is output for SSEL1 in master mode. The active state of the SSEL1 function is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL2
field.description: Transmit Slave Select . This field controls what is output for SSEL2 in master mode. The active state of the SSEL2 function is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL3
field.description: Transmit Slave Select . This field controls what is output for SSEL3 in master mode. The active state of the SSEL3 function is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer. The asserted SSEL will be deasserted at the end of a transfer, and remain so for at least the time specified by the Transfer_delay value in the DLY register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_NOT_DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL not deasserted. This piece of data is not treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will not be deasserted at the end of this data.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL deasserted. This piece of data is treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will be deasserted at the end of this piece of data.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame. Between frames, a delay may be inserted, as defined by the Frame_delay value in the DLY register. The end of a frame may not be particularly meaningful if the FRAME_DELAY value = 0. This control can be used as part of the support for frame lengths greater than 16 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_NOT_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data not EOF. This piece of data transmitted is not treated as the end of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data EOF. This piece of data is treated as the end of a frame, causing the FRAME_DELAY time to be inserted before subsequent data is transmitted.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore. This allows data to be transmitted using the SPI without the need to read unneeded data from the receiver to simplify the transmit process and can be used with the DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: READ_RECEIVED_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: Read received data. Received data must be read in order to allow transmission to progress. In slave mode, an overrun error will occur if received data is not read before new data is received.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNORE_RECEIVED_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: Ignore received data. Received data is ignored, allowing transmission without reading unneeded received data. No receiver flags are generated.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: FLEN
field.description: Frame Length. Specifies the frame length from 1 to 16 bits. Note that frame lengths greater than 16 bits are supported by implementing multiple sequential frames. Note that if a 1-bit frame is selected, the master function will always insert a delay with a length of one SCK time following the single clock seen on the SCK pin. 0x0 = Data frame is 1 bit in length. 0x1 = Data frame is 2 bits in length. 0x2 = Data frame is 3 bits in length. ... 0xF = Data frame is 16 bits in length.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 4 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only zero should be written.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXSSEL0
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 0.

field.name: TXSSEL1
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 1.

field.name: TXSSEL2
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 2.

field.name: TXSSEL3
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 3.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: FLEN
field.description: Frame Length.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: Rate divider value. Specifies how the PCLK for the SPI is divided to produce the SPI clock rate in master mode. DIVVAL is -1 encoded such that the value 0 results in PCLK/1, the value 1 results in PCLK/2, up to the maximum possible divide value of 0xFFFF, which results in PCLK/65536.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: RXOV
field.description: Receiver Overrun interrupt flag.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTEN
field.description: Master Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Master function are not changed, but the Master function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C Master function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C Master function is enabled.

field.name: SLVEN
field.description: Slave Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Slave function are not changed, but the Slave function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C slave function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C slave function is enabled.

field.name: MONEN
field.description: Monitor Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Monitor function are not changed, but the Monitor function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C monitor function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C monitor function is enabled.

field.name: TIMEOUTEN
field.description: I2C bus Time-out Enable. When disabled, the time-out function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Time-out function is enabled. Both types of time-out flags will be generated and will cause interrupts if they are enabled. Typically, only one time-out will be used in a system.

field.name: MONCLKSTR
field.description: Monitor function Clock Stretching.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The monitor function will not perform clock stretching. Software or DMA may not always be able to read data provided by the monitor function before it is overwritten. This mode may be used when non-invasive monitoring is critical.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The monitor function will perform clock stretching in order to ensure that software or DMA can read all incoming data supplied by the monitor function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: Status register for Master, Slave, and Monitor functions.

field.name: MSTPENDING
field.description: Master Pending. Indicates that the Master is waiting to continue communication on the I2C-bus (pending) or is idle. When the master is pending, the MSTSTATE bits indicate what type of software service if any the master expects. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if, enabled via the INTENSET register. The MSTPENDING flag is not set when the DMA is handling an event (if the MSTDMA bit in the MSTCTL register is set). If the master is in the idle state, and no communication is needed, mask this interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumeratedValue.description: In progress. Communication is in progress and the Master function is busy and cannot currently accept a command.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. The Master function needs software service or is in the idle state. If the master is not in the idle state, it is waiting to receive or transmit data or the NACK bit.

field.name: MSTSTATE
field.description: Master State code. The master state code reflects the master state when the MSTPENDING bit is set, that is the master is pending or in the idle state. Each value of this field indicates a specific required service for the Master function. All other values are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle. The Master function is available to be used for a new transaction.

enumeratedValue.name: RECEIVE_READY
enumeratedValue.description: Receive ready. Received data available (Master Receiver mode). Address plus Read was previously sent and Acknowledged by slave.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSMIT_READY
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit ready. Data can be transmitted (Master Transmitter mode). Address plus Write was previously sent and Acknowledged by slave.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: NACK Data. Slave NACKed transmitted data.

field.name: MSTARBLOSS
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss flag. This flag can be cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit. It is also cleared automatically a 1 is written to MSTCONTINUE.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_LOSS
enumeratedValue.description: No loss. No Arbitration Loss has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: ARBITRATION_LOSS
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration loss. The Master function has experienced an Arbitration Loss. At this point, the Master function has already stopped driving the bus and gone to an idle state. Software can respond by doing nothing, or by sending a Start in order to attempt to gain control of the bus when it next becomes idle.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error flag. This flag can be cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit. It is also cleared automatically a 1 is written to MSTCONTINUE.

enumeratedValue.name: STARTSTOP_ERROR_HAS
enumeratedValue.description: Start/stop error has occurred. The Master function has experienced a Start/Stop Error. A Start or Stop was detected at a time when it is not allowed by the I2C specification. The Master interface has stopped driving the bus and gone to an idle state, no action is required. A request for a Start could be made, or software could attempt to insure that the bus has not stalled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVPENDING
field.description: Slave Pending. Indicates that the Slave function is waiting to continue communication on the I2C-bus and needs software service. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via INTENSET. The SLVPENDING flag is not set when the DMA is handling an event (if the SLVDMA bit in the SLVCTL register is set). The SLVPENDING flag is read-only and is automatically cleared when a 1 is written to the SLVCONTINUE bit in the MSTCTL register.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumeratedValue.description: In progress. The Slave function does not currently need service.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. The Slave function needs service. Information on what is needed can be found in the adjacent SLVSTATE field.

field.name: SLVSTATE
field.description: Slave State code. Each value of this field indicates a specific required service for the Slave function. All other values are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_ADDRESS
enumeratedValue.description: Slave address. Address plus R/W received. At least one of the four slave addresses has been matched by hardware.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_RECEIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave receive. Received data is available (Slave Receiver mode).

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_TRANSMIT
enumeratedValue.description: Slave transmit. Data can be transmitted (Slave Transmitter mode).

field.name: SLVNOTSTR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching. Indicates when the slave function is stretching the I2C clock. This is needed in order to gracefully invoke Deep Sleep or Power-down modes during slave operation. This read-only flag reflects the slave function status in real time.

enumeratedValue.name: STRETCHING
enumeratedValue.description: Stretching. The slave function is currently stretching the I2C bus clock. Deep-Sleep or Power-down mode cannot be entered at this time.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_STRETCHING
enumeratedValue.description: Not stretching. The slave function is not currently stretching the I2C bus clock. Deep-sleep or Power-down mode could be entered at this time.

field.name: SLVIDX
field.description: Slave address match Index. This field is valid when the I2C slave function has been selected by receiving an address that matches one of the slave addresses defined by any enabled slave address registers, and provides an identification of the address that was matched. It is possible that more than one address could be matched, but only one match can be reported here.

field.name: SLVSEL
field.description: Slave selected flag. SLVSEL is set after an address match when software tells the Slave function to acknowledge the address. It is cleared when another address cycle presents an address that does not match an enabled address on the Slave function, when slave software decides to NACK a matched address, or when there is a Stop detected on the bus. SLVSEL is not cleared if software Nacks data.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not selected. The Slave function is not currently selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Selected. The Slave function is currently selected.

field.name: SLVDESEL
field.description: Slave Deselected flag. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via INTENSET. This flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DESELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not deselected. The Slave function has not become deselected. This does not mean that it is currently selected. That information can be found in the SLVSEL flag.

enumeratedValue.name: DESELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Deselected. The Slave function has become deselected. This is specifically caused by the SLVSEL flag changing from 1 to 0. See the description of SLVSEL for details on when that event occurs.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Monitor Ready. This flag is cleared when the MONRXDAT register is read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: No data. The Monitor function does not currently have data available.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Data waiting. The Monitor function has data waiting to be read.

field.name: MONOV
field.description: Monitor Overflow flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_OVERRUN
enumeratedValue.description: No overrun. Monitor data has not overrun.

enumeratedValue.name: OVERRUN
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun. A Monitor data overrun has occurred. This can only happen when Monitor clock stretching not enabled via the MONCLKSTR bit in the CFG register. Writing 1 to this bit clears the flag.

field.name: MONACTIVE
field.description: Monitor Active flag. This flag indicates when the Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be active. Active is defined here as when some Master is on the bus: a bus Start has occurred more recently than a bus Stop.

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive. The Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be inactive.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Active. The Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be active.

field.name: MONIDLE
field.description: Monitor Idle flag. This flag is set when the Monitor function sees the I2C bus change from active to inactive. This can be used by software to decide when to process data accumulated by the Monitor function. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via the INTENSET register . The flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Not idle. The I2C bus is not idle, or this flag has been cleared by software.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle. The I2C bus has gone idle at least once since the last time this flag was cleared by software.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUT
field.description: Event Time-out Interrupt flag. Indicates when the time between events has been longer than the time specified by the TIMEOUT register. Events include Start, Stop, and clock edges. The flag is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. No time-out is created when the I2C-bus is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: No time-out. I2C bus events have not caused a time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT_TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: Event time-out. The time between I2C bus events has been longer than the time specified by the I2C TIMEOUT register.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUT
field.description: SCL Time-out Interrupt flag. Indicates when SCL has remained low longer than the time specific by the TIMEOUT register. The flag is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: No time-out. SCL low time has not caused a time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: TIME_OUT
enumeratedValue.description: Time-out. SCL low time has caused a time-out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable Set and read register.

field.name: MSTPENDINGEN
field.description: Master Pending interrupt Enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTARBLOSSEN
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss interrupt Enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.description: Event time-out interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.description: The Event time-out interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_EVENT_TIME_OUT_I
enumeratedValue.description: The Event time-out interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.description: The SCL time-out interrupt is disabled.

field.name: MSTPENDINGCLR
field.description: Master Pending interrupt clear. Writing 1 to this bit clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register if implemented.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.description: Master Arbitration Loss interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.description: Event time-out interrupt clear.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUTCLR
field.description: SCL time-out interrupt clear.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TOMIN
field.description: Time-out time value, bottom four bits. These are hard-wired to 0xF. This gives a minimum time-out of 16 I2C function clocks and also a time-out resolution of 16 I2C function clocks.

field.name: TO
field.description: Time-out time value. Specifies the time-out interval value in increments of 16 I 2C function clocks, as defined by the CLKDIV register. To change this value while I2C is in operation, disable all time-outs, write a new value to TIMEOUT, then re-enable time-outs. 0x000 = A time-out will occur after 16 counts of the I2C function clock. 0x001 = A time-out will occur after 32 counts of the I2C function clock. ... 0xFFF = A time-out will occur after 65,536 counts of the I2C function clock.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CLKDIV
register.description: Clock pre-divider for the entire I2C block. This determines what time increments are used for the MSTTIME and SLVTIME registers.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: This field controls how the clock (PCLK) is used by the I2C functions that need an internal clock in order to operate. 0x0000 = PCLK is used directly by the I2C function. 0x0001 = PCLK is divided by 2 before use by the I 2C function. 0x0002 = PCLK is divided by 3 before use by the I 2C function. ... 0xFFFF = PCLK is divided by 65,536 before use by the I2C function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt Status register for Master, Slave, and Monitor functions.

field.name: MSTPENDING
field.description: Master Pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: MSTARBLOSS
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.
