field.description: Slave Pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVNOTSTR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVDESEL
field.description: Slave Deselected flag.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Monitor Ready.

field.name: MONOV
field.description: Monitor Overflow flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MONIDLE
field.description: Monitor Idle flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUT
field.description: Event time-out Interrupt flag.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUT
field.description: SCL time-out Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTCONTINUE
field.description: Master Continue. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUE
enumeratedValue.description: Continue. Informs the Master function to continue to the next operation. This must done after writing transmit data, reading received data, or any other housekeeping related to the next bus operation.

field.name: MSTSTART
field.description: Master Start control. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Start. A Start will be generated on the I2C bus at the next allowed time.

field.name: MSTSTOP
field.description: Master Stop control. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop. A Stop will be generated on the I2C bus at the next allowed time, preceded by a NACK to the slave if the master is receiving data from the slave (Master Receiver mode).

field.name: MSTDMA
field.description: Master DMA enable. Data operations of the I2C can be performed with DMA. Protocol type operations such as Start, address, Stop, and address match must always be done with software, typically via an interrupt. When a DMA data transfer is complete, MSTDMA must be cleared prior to beginning the next operation, typically a Start or Stop.This bit is read/write.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. No DMA requests are generated for master operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A DMA request is generated for I2C master data operations. When this I2C master is generating Acknowledge bits in Master Receiver mode, the acknowledge is generated automatically.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MSTSCLLOW
field.description: Master SCL Low time. Specifies the minimum low time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other devices on the bus (masters or slaves) could lengthen this time. This corresponds to the parameter tLOW in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tBUF and t SU;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLLOW.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 2 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 4_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 4 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 5_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 5 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 6 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 7 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 8 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: MSTSCLHIGH
field.description: Master SCL High time. Specifies the minimum high time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other masters in a multi-master system could shorten this time. This corresponds to the parameter tHIGH in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tSU;STO and tHD;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLHIGH.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 2 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider .

enumeratedValue.name: 4_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 4 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 5_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 5 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 6 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 7 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 8 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: MSTDAT
register.description: Combined Master receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Master function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Master function. Write: transmit data using the Master function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVCONTINUE
field.description: Slave Continue.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUE
enumeratedValue.description: Continue. Informs the Slave function to continue to the next operation. This must done after writing transmit data, reading received data, or any other housekeeping related to the next bus operation.

field.name: SLVNACK
field.description: Slave NACK.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK
enumeratedValue.description: NACK. Causes the Slave function to NACK the master when the slave is receiving data from the master (Slave Receiver mode).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SLVDMA
field.description: Slave DMA enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No DMA requests are issued for Slave mode operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. DMA requests are issued for I2C slave data transmission and reception.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: SLVDAT
register.description: Combined Slave receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Slave function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Slave function. Write: transmit data using the Slave function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SADISABLE
field.description: Slave Address n Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Slave Address n is enabled and will be recognized with any changes specified by the SLVQUAL0 register.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNORED_SLAVE_ADDRES
enumeratedValue.description: Ignored Slave Address n is ignored.

field.name: SLVADR
field.description: Seven bit slave address that is compared to received addresses if enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: QUALMODE0
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SLVQUAL0_FIELD_I
enumeratedValue.description: The SLVQUAL0 field is used as a logical mask for matching address 0.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SLVQUAL0_FIELD_I
enumeratedValue.description: The SLVQUAL0 field is used to extend address 0 matching in a range of addresses.

field.name: SLVQUAL0
field.description: Slave address Qualifier for address 0. A value of 0 causes the address in SLVADR0 to be used as-is, assuming that it is enabled. If QUALMODE0 = 0, any bit in this field which is set to 1 will cause an automatic match of the corresponding bit of the received address when it is compared to the SLVADR0 register. If QUALMODE0 = 1, an address range is matched for address 0. This range extends from the value defined by SLVADR0 to the address defined by SLVQUAL0 (address matches when SLVADR0[7:1] < = received address <= SLVQUAL0[7:1]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: MONRXDAT
field.description: Monitor function Receiver Data. This reflects every data byte that passes on the I2C pins, and adds indication of Start, Repeated Start, and data NACK.

field.name: MONSTART
field.description: Monitor Received Start.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_DETECT
enumeratedValue.description: No detect. The monitor function has not detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: START_DETECT
enumeratedValue.description: Start detect. The monitor function has detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

field.name: MONRESTART
field.description: Monitor Received Repeated Start.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START_DETECT
enumeratedValue.description: No start detect. The monitor function has not detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: REPEATED_START_DETEC
enumeratedValue.description: Repeated start detect. The monitor function has detected a Repeated Start event on the I 2C bus.

field.name: MONNACK
field.description: Monitor Received NACK.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the monitor function was acknowledged by at least one master or slave receiver.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the monitor function was not acknowledged by any receiver.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RESP
field.description: Reset position counter. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros. Autoclears when the position counter is cleared.

field.name: RESPI
field.description: Reset position counter on index. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros when an index pulse occurs. Autoclears when the position counter is cleared.

field.name: RESV
field.description: Reset velocity. When set = 1, resets the velocity counter to all zeros and reloads the velocity timer. Autoclears when the velocity counter is cleared.

field.name: RESI
field.description: Reset index counter. When set = 1, resets the index counter to all zeros. Autoclears when the index counter is cleared.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: DIR
field.description: Direction bit. In combination with DIRINV bit indicates forward or reverse direction. See Table 284.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: DIRINV
field.description: Direction invert. When = 1, complements the DIR bit.

field.name: SIGMODE
field.description: Signal Mode. When = 0, PhA and PhB function as quadrature encoder inputs. When = 1, PhA functions as the direction signal and PhB functions as the clock signal.

field.name: CAPMODE
field.description: Capture Mode. When = 0, only PhA edges are counted (2X). When = 1, BOTH PhA and PhB edges are counted (4X), increasing resolution but decreasing range.

field.name: INVINX
field.description: Invert Index. When set, inverts the sense of the index input.

field.name: CRESPI
field.description: Continuously reset position counter on index. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros when an index pulse occurs at the next position increase (recalibration). Auto-clears when the position counter is cleared.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: INXGATE
field.description: Index gating configuration: when INXGATE(19)=1, pass the index when Pha=0 and Phb=0, else block. when INXGATE(18)=1, pass the index when Pha=0 and Phb=1, else block. when INXGATE(17)=1, pass the index when Pha=1 and Phb=1, else block. when INXGATE(16)=1, pass the index when Pha=1 and Phb=0, else block.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: POS
field.description: Current position value.

field.name: MAXPOS
field.description: Maximum position value.

field.name: PCMP0
field.description: Position compare value 0.

field.name: PCMP1
field.description: Position compare value 1.

field.name: PCMP2
field.description: Position compare value 2.

field.name: ENCPOS
field.description: Current encoder position value.

field.name: ICMP0
field.description: Index compare value.

field.name: VELLOAD
field.description: Current velocity timer pre-load value.The velocity timer counts down from this value.

field.name: VELVAL
field.description: Current velocity timer value.

field.name: VELPC
field.description: Current velocity pulse count.

field.name: VELCAP
field.description: Velocity capture value.

field.name: VELCMP
field.description: Velocity compare value.

register.name: FILTERPHA
register.description: Digital filter register on input phase A (QEI_A)

field.name: FILTA
field.description: Digital filter sampling delay

register.name: FILTERPHB
register.description: Digital filter register on input phase B (QEI_B)

field.name: FILTB
field.description: Digital filter sampling delay

register.name: FILTERINX
register.description: Digital filter register on input index (QEI_IDX)

field.name: FITLINX
field.description: Digital filter sampling delay

field.name: WINDOW
field.description: Index acceptance window width

field.name: ICMP1
field.description: Index compare value 1.

field.name: ICMP2
field.description: Index compare value 2.

field.name: INX_EN
field.description: Indicates that an index pulse was detected.

field.name: TIM_EN
field.description: Indicates that a velocity timer overflow occurred

field.name: VELC_EN
field.description: Indicates that captured velocity is less than compare velocity.

field.name: DIR_EN
field.description: Indicates that a change of direction was detected.

field.name: ERR_EN
field.description: Indicates that an encoder phase error was detected.

field.name: ENCLK_EN
field.description: Indicates that and encoder clock pulse was detected.

field.name: POS0_INT
field.description: Indicates that the position 0 compare value is equal to the current position.

field.name: POS1_INT
field.description: Indicates that the position 1compare value is equal to the current position.

field.name: POS2_INT
field.description: Indicates that the position 2 compare value is equal to the current position.

field.name: REV0_INT
field.description: Indicates that the index 0 compare value is equal to the current index count.

field.name: POS0REV_INT
field.description: Combined position 0 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS0_INT bit is set and the REV0_Int is set.

field.name: POS1REV_INT
field.description: Combined position 1 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS1_INT bit is set and the REV1_INT is set.

field.name: POS2REV_INT
field.description: Combined position 2 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS2_INT bit is set and the REV2_INT is set.

field.name: REV1_INT
field.description: Indicates that the index 1 compare value is equal to the current index count.

field.name: REV2_INT
field.description: Indicates that the index 2 compare value is equal to the current index count.

field.name: MAXPOS_INT
field.description: Indicates that the current position count goes through the MAXPOS value to zero in forward direction, or through zero to MAXPOS in backward direction.

register.name: INTVAL%s
register.description: MRT0 Time interval value register. This value is loaded into the TIMER0 register.

field.name: IVALUE
field.description: Time interval load value. This value is loaded into the TIMERn register and the MRTn starts counting down from IVALUE -1. If the timer is idle, writing a non-zero value to this bit field starts the timer immediately. If the timer is running, writing a zero to this bit field does the following: If LOAD = 1, the timer stops immediately. If LOAD = 0, the timer stops at the end of the time interval.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: LOAD
field.description: Determines how the timer interval value IVALUE -1 is loaded into the TIMERn register. This bit is write-only. Reading this bit always returns 0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FORCE_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: No force load. The load from the INTVALn register to the TIMERn register is processed at the end of the time interval if the repeat mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: FORCE_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Force load. The INTVALn interval value IVALUE -1 is immediately loaded into the TIMERn register while TIMERn is running.

register.name: TIMER%s
register.description: MRT0 Timer register. This register reads the value of the down-counter.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Holds the current timer value of the down-counter. The initial value of the TIMERn register is loaded as IVALUE - 1 from the INTVALn register either at the end of the time interval or immediately in the following cases: INTVALn register is updated in the idle state. INTVALn register is updated with LOAD = 1. When the timer is in idle state, reading this bit fields returns -1 (0x00FF FFFF).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CTRL%s
register.description: MRT0 Control register. This register controls the MRT0 modes.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Enable the TIMERn interrupt.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects timer mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: INTFLAG
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pending interrupt. The interrupt is pending because TIMERn has reached the end of the time interval. If the INTEN bit in the CONTROLn is also set to 1, the interrupt for timer channel n and the global interrupt are raised. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the interrupt request.

field.name: RUN
field.description: Indicates the state of TIMERn. This bit is read-only.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: IDLE_CH
register.description: Idle channel register. This register returns the number of the first idle channel.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: CHAN
field.description: Idle channel. Reading the CHAN bits, returns the lowest idle timer channel. If all timer channels are running, CHAN = 4. To make sure that all outstanding interrupt requests have been serviced, a channel is considered idle only when both the corresponding RUN bit and the interrupt flag are zero in the STATUS register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: GFLAG0
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pending interrupt. The interrupt is pending because TIMER0 has reached the end of the time interval. If the INTEN bit in the CONTROL0 register is also set to 1, the interrupt for timer channel 0 and the global interrupt are raised. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the interrupt request.

field.name: GFLAG1
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER1.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT

field.name: GFLAG2
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER2.

enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT

field.name: GFLAG3
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER3.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT

field.name: RDET0
field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: PSTAT0
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT1
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT2
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT3
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT4
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT5
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT6
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT7
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: SEL_PMATCH
field.description: Specifies whether the 8 pin interrupts are controlled by the pin interrupt function or by the pattern match function.

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_INTERRUPT_INTER
enumeratedValue.description: Pin interrupt. Interrupts are driven in response to the standard pin interrupt function

enumeratedValue.name: PATTERN_MATCH_INTER
enumeratedValue.description: Pattern match. Interrupts are driven in response to pattern matches.

field.name: ENA_RXEV
field.description: Enables the RXEV output to the ARM cpu and/or to a GPIO output when the specified boolean expression evaluates to true.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED_RXEV_OUTPU
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. RXEV output to the cpu is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED_RXEV_OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. RXEV output to the cpu is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Do not write 1s to unused bits.

field.name: PMAT
field.description: This field displays the current state of pattern matches. A 1 in any bit of this field indicates that the corresponding product term is matched by the current state of the appropriate inputs.

register.name: PMSRC

field.name: Reserved
field.description: Software should not write 1s to unused bits.

register.name: PMCFG
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit slice configuration register

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS
field.description: A 1 in any bit of this field causes the corresponding bit slice to be the final component of a product term in the boolean expression. This has two effects: 1. The interrupt request associated with this bit-slice will be asserted whenever a match to that product term is detected. 2. The next bit slice will start a new, independent product term in the boolean expression (i.e. an OR will be inserted in the boolean expression following the element controlled by this bit slice).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Bit slice 7 is automatically considered a product end point.

field.name: CFG0
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH_THIS_
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGEMA
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edgeMatch occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE_
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_OR_FAL
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL_MATCH_F
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL_MATCH_OCC
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_0_THIS_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT_NON_STICKY_RI
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of option 3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 1.

enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_0_THIS_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT_NON_STICKY_RI
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of option 3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

field.name: INT
field.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

field.name: COMB
field.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: OR_FUNCTIONALITY_A_
enumeratedValue.description: OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

enumeratedValue.name: AND_FUNCTIONALITY_A
enumeratedValue.description: AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Group interrupt trigger

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: PORT_POL[%s]
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

field.name: POL0
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port m pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin PIOm_n of port m. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

register.name: COMPVAL
register.description: Compare value LSB register. Holds the 32 LSBs of the compare value.

field.name: RICOMP
field.description: Compare register. Holds the 32 LSBs of the compare value which is compared to the counter.

register.name: MASK
register.description: Mask LSB register. This register holds the 32 LSB s of the mask value. A 1 written to any bit will force a compare on the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

field.name: RIMASK
field.description: Mask register. This register holds the 32 LSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

field.name: RITINT
field.description: Interrupt flag

enumeratedValue.name: THIS_BIT_IS_SET_TO_1
enumeratedValue.description: This bit is set to 1 by hardware whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of RICOMPVAL and RIMASK registers. Writing a 1 to this bit will clear it to 0. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_VALUE_DO
enumeratedValue.description: The counter value does not equal the masked compare value.

field.name: RITENCLR
field.description: Timer enable clear

enumeratedValue.name: THE_TIMER_WILL_BE_CL
enumeratedValue.description: The timer will be cleared to 0 whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of COMPVAL/COMPVAL_H and MASK/MASK_H registers. This will occur on the same clock that sets the interrupt flag.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_TIMER_WILL_NOT_B
enumeratedValue.description: The timer will not be cleared to 0.

field.name: RITENBR
field.description: Timer enable for debug

enumeratedValue.name: THE_TIMER_IS_HALTED
enumeratedValue.description: The timer is halted when the processor is halted for debugging.

enumeratedValue.name: DEBUG_HAS_NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: Debug has no effect on the timer operation.

field.name: RITEN
field.description: Timer enable.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Timer enabled. This can be overruled by a debug halt if enabled in bit 2.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: COUNTER
register.description: Counter LSB register. 32 LSBs of the counter.

field.name: RICOUNTER
field.description: 32 LSBs of the up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in CTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

register.name: COMPVAL_H
register.description: Compare value MSB register. Holds the 16 MSBs of the compare value.

field.name: RICOMP
field.description: Compare value MSB register. Holds the 16 MSBs of the compare value which is compared to the counter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: MASK_H
register.description: Mask MSB register. This register holds the 16 MSBs of the mask value. A 1 written to any bit will force a compare on the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

field.name: RIMASK
field.description: Mask register. This register holds the 16 MSBs of the mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: COUNTER_H
register.description: Counter MSB register. 16 MSBs of the counter.

field.name: RICOUNTER
field.description: 16 LSBs of the up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in RICTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: SAMPLE_CTRL
register.description: SCT IPU sample control register. Contains the input mux selects, latch/sample-enable mux selects, and sample overrride bits for the SAMPLE module.

field.name: IN0SEL
field.description: Select SCT IPU input source for output channel 0.

field.name: IN1SEL
field.description: Select SCT IPU input source for output channel 1.

field.name: IN2SEL
field.description: Select SCT IPU input source for output channel 2.

field.name: IN3SEL
field.description: Select. SCT IPU input source for output channel 3.

field.name: SAMPLE_EN0SEL
field.description: Select the sample enable input as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(0) latch. Depending on the value of the corresponding LATCHn_EN bit, this latch is transparent when the LATCHn_EN bit is 1 or latched when the LATCHn_EN bit is 0.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_SAMPLE_ENABL
enumeratedValue.description: Selects Sample_Enable_A as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(0) latch.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_SAMPLE_ENABL
enumeratedValue.description: Selects Sample_Enable_B as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(0) latch.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_SAMPLE_ENABL
enumeratedValue.description: Selects Sample_Enable_C as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(0) latch.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_SAMPLE_ENABL
enumeratedValue.description: Selects Sample_Enable_D as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(0) latch.

enumeratedValue.description: Selects Sample_Enable_B as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(1) latch.

enumeratedValue.description: Selects Sample_Enable_C as the latch/sample-enable control for the Sample_Output(1) latch.

field.name: LATCHEN0
field.description: Enable latch for output channel 0.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSPARENT_MODE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Transparent mode. Sample_Output(0) latch is forced into transparent mode. The selected Sample_Input is passed directly through to Sample_Output(0). The sample-enable control line selected for this latch has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: LATCHED_MODE_THE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Latched mode. The Sample_Output(0) latch is operational and will sample or latch based on the state of the selected sample-enable control signal.

field.name: LATCHEN1
field.description: Enable latch for output channel 1.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSPARENT_MODE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Transparent mode. Sample_Output(1) latch is forced into transparent mode. The selected Sample_Input is passed directly through to Sample_Output(1). The sample-enable control line selected for this latch has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: LATCHED_MODE_THE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Latched mode. The Sample_Output(1) latch is operational and will sample or latch based on the state of the selected sample-enable control signal.

field.name: LATCHEN2
field.description: Enable latch for output channel 2.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSPARENT_MODE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Transparent mode. Sample_Output(2) latch is forced into transparent mode. The selected Sample_Input is passed directly through to Sample_Output(2). The sample-enable control line selected for this latch has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: LATCHED_MODE_THE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Latched mode. The Sample_Output(2) latch is operational and will sample or latch based on the state of the selected sample-enable control signal.

field.name: LATCHEN3
field.description: Enable latch for output channel 3.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSPARENT_MODE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Transparent mode. Sample_Output(3) latch is forced into transparent mode. The selected Sample_Input is passed directly through to Sample_Output(3). The sample-enable control line selected for this latch has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: LATCHED_MODE_THE_SA
enumeratedValue.description: Latched mode. The Sample_Output(3) latch is operational and will sample or latch based on the state of the selected sample-enable control signal.

register.name: ABORT_ENABLE%s
register.description: SCT IPU abort enable register: Selects which input source contributes to ORed Abort Output 0.

field.name: ENA0
field.description: Enable abort source SCT_ABORT0.

field.name: ENA1
field.description: Enable abort source SCT_ABORT1.

field.name: ENA2
field.description: Enable abort source ACMP0 output.

field.name: ENA3
field.description: Enable abort source ACMP1 output.

field.name: ENA4
field.description: Enable abort source ACMP2 output.

field.name: ENA5
field.description: Enable abort source ACMP3 output.

field.name: ENA6
field.description: Enable abort source SCT0_OUT9.

field.name: ENA7
field.description: Enable abort source ADC0_THCMP_IRQ.

field.name: ENA8
field.description: Enable abort source ADC1_THCMP_IRQ.

register.name: ABORT_SOURCE%s
register.description: SCT IPU abort source register: Status register indicating which input source caused abort output 0.

field.name: ACT0
field.description: Source SCT_ABORT0 activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear. This function can be assigned to any pin via the PINASSIGN10 register in the switch matrix.

field.name: ACT1
field.description: Source SCT_ABORT1 activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear. This function can be assigned to any pin via the PINASSIGN10 register in the switch matrix.

field.name: ACT2
field.description: Source ACMP0 output activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: ACT3
field.description: Source ACMP1 output activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: ACT4
field.description: Source ACMP2 output activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: ACT5
field.description: Source ACMP3 output activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: ACT6
field.description: Source SCT0_OUT9 activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: ACT7
field.description: Source ADC0_THCMP_IRQ activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: ACT8
field.description: Source ADC1_THCMP_IRQ activated. This bit is set by hardware when the source is actived. Write 0 to clear.

field.name: START
field.description: Signature generation start address (corresponds to AHB byte address bits[20:4]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: STOPA
field.description: Stop address for signature generation (the word specified by STOPA is included in the address range). The address is in units of memory words, not bytes.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: STRTBIST
field.description: When this bit is written to 1, signature generation starts. At the end of signature generation, this bit is automatically cleared.

field.name: SIG
field.description: 32-bit signature.

field.name: INIT
field.description: Initialization

enumeratedValue.name: STARTED
enumeratedValue.description: Started. Initialization is started. On reset, software needs to initialize the CAN controller.

field.name: IE
field.description: Module interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE_CAN_INTERRUP
enumeratedValue.description: Disable CAN interrupts. The interrupt line is always HIGH.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_CAN_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Enable CAN interrupts. The interrupt line is set to LOW and remains LOW until all pending interrupts are cleared.

field.name: SIE
field.description: Status change interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE_STATUS_CHANG
enumeratedValue.description: Disable status change interrupts. No status change interrupt will be generated.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_STATUS_CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable status change interrupts. A status change interrupt will be generated when a message transfer is successfully completed or a CAN bus error is detected.

field.name: EIE
field.description: Error interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE_ERROR_INTERR
enumeratedValue.description: Disable error interrupt. No error status interrupt will be generated.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_ERROR_INTERRU
enumeratedValue.description: Enable error interrupt. A change in the bits BOFF or EWARN in the CANSTAT registers will generate an interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: DAR
field.description: Disable automatic retransmission

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Automatic retransmission of disturbed messages enabled.

field.name: CCE
field.description: Configuration change enable

enumeratedValue.name: NO_WRITE_ACCESS
enumeratedValue.description: No write access. The CPU has no write access to the bit timing register.

enumeratedValue.name: WRITE_ACCESS
enumeratedValue.description: Write access. The CPU has write access to the CANBT register while the INIT bit is one.

field.name: TEST
field.description: Test mode enable

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: LEC
field.description: Last error code Type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus.The LEC field holds a code which indicates the type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus. This field will be cleared to 0 when a message has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. The unused code 111 may be written by the CPU to check for updates.

enumeratedValue.name: STUFF_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Stuff error. More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed.

enumeratedValue.name: FORM_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Form error. A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKERROR
enumeratedValue.description: AckError. The message this CAN core transmitted was not acknowledged.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT1ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Bit1Error. During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a HIGH/recessive level (bit of logical value 1), but the monitored bus value was LOW/dominant.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT0ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Bit0Error. During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a LOW/dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value 0), but the monitored Bus value was HIGH/recessive. During busoff recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 HIGH/recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the CPU to monitor the proceeding of the busoff recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at LOW/dominant or continuously disturbed).

enumeratedValue.name: CRCERROR
enumeratedValue.description: CRCError. The CRC checksum was incorrect in the message received.

enumeratedValue.name: UNUSED
enumeratedValue.description: Unused. No CAN bus event was detected (written by the CPU).

field.name: TXOK
field.description: Transmitted a message successfully This bit must be reset by the CPU. It is never reset by the CAN controller.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TRANSMIT
enumeratedValue.description: No transmit. Since this bit was last reset by the CPU, no message has been successfully transmitted.

enumeratedValue.name: SUCCESSFUL_TRANSMIT
enumeratedValue.description: Successful transmit. Since this bit was last reset by the CPU, a message has been successfully transmitted (error free and acknowledged by at least one other node).

field.name: RXOK
field.description: Received a message successfully This bit must be reset by the CPU. It is never reset by the CAN controller.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_RECEIVE
enumeratedValue.description: No receive. Since this bit was last reset by the CPU, no message has been successfully received.

enumeratedValue.name: SUCCESSFUL_RECEIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Successful receive.Since this bit was last set to zero by the CPU, a message has been successfully received independent of the result of acceptance filtering.

field.name: EPASS
field.description: Error passive

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Active. The CAN controller is in the error active state.

enumeratedValue.name: PASSIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Passive. The CAN controller is in the error passive state as defined in the CAN 2.0 specification.

field.name: EWARN
field.description: Warning status

enumeratedValue.name: BELOW_LIMIT
enumeratedValue.description: Below limit. Both error counters are below the error warning limit of 96.

enumeratedValue.name: AT_LIMIT
enumeratedValue.description: At limit. At least one of the error counters in the EC has reached the error warning limit of 96.

field.name: BOFF
field.description: Busoff status

enumeratedValue.name: THE_CAN_MODULE_IS_NO
enumeratedValue.description: The CAN module is not in busoff.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_CAN_CONTROLLER_I
enumeratedValue.description: The CAN controller is in busoff state.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: TEC7_0
field.description: Transmit error counter Current value of the transmit error counter (maximum value 255)

field.name: REC6_0
field.description: Receive error counter Current value of the receive error counter (maximum value 127).

field.name: RP
field.description: Receive error passive

enumeratedValue.name: BELOW_ERROR_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Below error level. The receive counter is below the error passive level.

enumeratedValue.name: AT_ERROR_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: At error level. The receive counter has reached the error passive level as defined in the CAN2.0 specification.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: BRP
field.description: Baud rate prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Baud Rate Prescaler are 0 to 63.[1]

field.name: SJW
field.description: (Re)synchronization jump width Valid programmed values are 0 to 3.[1]

field.name: TSEG1
field.description: Time segment before the sample point Valid values are 1 to 15.[1]

field.name: TSEG2
field.description: Time segment after the sample point Valid values are 0 to 7.[1]

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: INTID
field.description: 0x0000 = No interrupt is pending. 0x0001 - 0x0020 = Number of message object which caused the interrupt. 0x0021 - 0x7FFF = Unused 0x8000 = Status interrupt 0x8001 - 0xFFFF = Unused

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: BASIC
field.description: Basic mode

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. IF1 registers used as TX buffer, IF2 registers used as RX buffer.

field.name: SILENT
field.description: Silent mode

enumeratedValue.name: SILENT_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Silent mode. The module is in silent mode.

field.name: LBACK
field.description: Loop back mode

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Loop back mode is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Loop back mode is enabled.

field.name: TX
field.description: Control of CAN_TXD pins

enumeratedValue.name: CONTROLLER
enumeratedValue.description: Controller. Level at the CAN_TXD pin is controlled by the CAN controller. This is the value at reset.

enumeratedValue.name: SAMPLE_POINT
enumeratedValue.description: Sample point. The sample point can be monitored at the CAN_TXD pin.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. CAN_TXD pin is driven LOW/dominant.

enumeratedValue.name: HOGH
enumeratedValue.description: Hogh. CAN_TXD pin is driven HIGH/recessive.

field.name: RX
field.description: Monitors the actual value of the CAN_RXD pin.

enumeratedValue.name: RECESSIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Recessive. The CAN bus is recessive (CAN_RXD = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: DOMINANT
enumeratedValue.description: Dominant. The CAN bus is dominant (CAN_RXD = 0).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: R/W

field.name: BRPE
field.description: Baud rate prescaler extension By programming BRPE the Baud Rate Prescaler can be extended to values up to 1023. Hardware interprets the value as the value of BRPE (MSBs) and BRP (LSBs) plus one. Allowed values are 0 to 15.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MN
field.description: Message number 0x01 - 0x20 = Valid message numbers. The message object in the message RAM is selected for data transfer. 0x00 = Not a valid message number. This value is interpreted as 0x20.[1] 0x21 - 0x3F = Not a valid message number. This value is interpreted as 0x01 - 0x1F.[1]

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: BUSY
field.description: BUSY flag

enumeratedValue.name: DONE
enumeratedValue.description: Done. Set to zero by hardware when read/write action to this Command request register has finished.

enumeratedValue.name: BUSY
enumeratedValue.description: Busy. Set to one by hardware when writing to this Command request register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DATA_B
field.description: Access data bytes 4-7

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer data bytes 4-7 to message object.

field.name: DATA_A
field.description: Access data bytes 0-3

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer data bytes 0-3 to message object.

field.name: TXRQST
field.description: Access transmission request bit

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TRANSMISSION_REQU
enumeratedValue.description: No transmission request. TXRQSRT bit unchanged in IF1/2_MCTRL. If a transmission is requested by programming this bit, the TXRQST bit in the CANIFn_MCTRL register is ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: REQUEST_A_TRANSMISSI
enumeratedValue.description: Request a transmission. Set the TXRQST bit IF1/2_MCTRL.

field.name: CLRINTPND
field.description: This bit is ignored in the write direction.

field.name: CTRL
field.description: Access control bits

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer control bits to message object

field.name: ARB
field.description: Access arbitration bits

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer Identifier, DIR, XTD, and MSGVAL bits to message object.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Access mask bits

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer Identifier MASK + MDIR + MXTD to message object.

field.name: WR_RD
field.description: Write transfer Transfer data from the selected message buffer registers to the message object addressed by the command request register CANIFn_CMDREQ.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: DATA_B
field.description: Access data bytes 4-7

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer data bytes 4-7 to IFx message buffer register.

field.name: DATA_A
field.description: Access data bytes 0-3

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer data bytes 0-3 to IFx message buffer.

field.name: NEWDAT
field.description: Access new data bit

enumeratedValue.name: UNCHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: Unchanged. NEWDAT bit remains unchanged. A read access to a message object can be combined with the reset of the control bits INTPND and NEWDAT in IF1/2_MCTRL. The values of these bits transferred to the IFx Message Control Register always reflect the status before resetting these bits.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear NEWDAT bit in the message object.

field.name: CLRINTPND
field.description: Clear interrupt pending bit.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear INTPND bit in the message object.

field.name: CTRL
field.description: Access control bits

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer control bits to IFx message buffer.

field.name: ARB
field.description: Access arbitration bits

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer Identifier, DIR, XTD, and MSGVAL bits to IFx message buffer register.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Access mask bits

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Transfer. Transfer Identifier MASK + MDIR + MXTD to IFx message buffer register.

field.name: WR_RD
field.description: Read transfer Transfer data from the message object addressed by the command request register to the selected message buffer registers CANIFn_CMDREQ.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

field.name: MSK15_0
field.description: Identifier mask [15:0]

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. The corresponding bit in the identifier of the message cannot inhibit the match in the acceptance filtering.

enumeratedValue.name: MASK
enumeratedValue.description: Mask. The corresponding identifier bit is used for acceptance filtering.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MSK28_16
field.description: Identifier mask [28:16]

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. The corresponding bit in the identifier of the message cannot inhibit the match in the acceptance filtering.

enumeratedValue.name: MASK
enumeratedValue.description: Mask. The corresponding identifier bit is used for acceptance filtering.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MDIR
field.description: Mask message direction

enumeratedValue.name: WITHOUT_DIR_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: Without DIR bit. The message direction bit (DIR) has no effect on acceptance filtering.

enumeratedValue.name: WITH_DIR_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: With DIR bit. The message direction bit (DIR) is used for acceptance filtering.

field.name: MXTD
field.description: Mask extend identifier

enumeratedValue.name: WITHOUT_XTD
enumeratedValue.description: Without XTD. The extended identifier bit (XTD) has no effect on acceptance filtering.

enumeratedValue.name: WITH_XTD
enumeratedValue.description: With XTD. The extended identifier bit (XTD) is used for acceptance filtering.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ID15_0
field.description: Message identifier [15:0] 29-bit identifier (extended frame) 11-bit identifier (standard frame)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ID28_16
field.description: Message identifier 29-bit identifier (extended frame) 11-bit identifier (standard frame)

field.name: DIR
field.description: Message direction

enumeratedValue.name: RECEIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Receive. On TXRQST, a Remote Frame with the identifier of this Message Object is transmitted. On reception of a Data Frame with matching identifier, that message is stored in this Message Object.

enumeratedValue.name: TANSMIT
enumeratedValue.description: Tansmit. On TXRQST, the respective Message Object is transmitted as a Data Frame. On reception of a Remote Frame with matching identifier, the TXRQST bit of this Message Object is set (if RMTEN = one).

field.name: XTD
field.description: Extend identifier

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The 11-bit standard identifier will be used for this message object.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTENDED
enumeratedValue.description: Extended. The 29-bit extended identifier will be used for this message object.

field.name: MSGVAL
field.description: Message valid The CPU must reset the MSGVAL bit of all unused Messages Objects during the initialization before it resets bit INIT in the CAN Control Register. This bit must also be reset before the identifier ID28:0, the control bits XTD, DIR, or the Data Length Code DLC3:0 are modified, or if the Messages Object is no longer required.

enumeratedValue.name: INVALID
enumeratedValue.description: Invalid. The message object is ignored by the message handler.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Valid. The message object is configured and should be considered by the message handler.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DLC3_0
field.description: Data length code 3:0 The Data Length Code of a Message Object must be defined the same as in all the corresponding objects with the same identifier at other nodes. When the Message Handler stores a data frame, it will write the DLC to the value given by the received message. 0000 - 1000 = Data frame has 0 - 8 data bytes. 1001 - 1111 = Data frame has 8 data bytes.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EOB
field.description: End of buffer

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_END_OF_BUFFER
enumeratedValue.description: Not end of buffer. Message object belongs to a FIFO buffer and is not the last message object of that FIFO buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: END_OF_BUFFER
enumeratedValue.description: End of buffer. Single message object or last message object of a FIFO buffer.

field.name: TXRQST
field.description: Transmit request

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Not waiting. This message object is not waiting for transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Waiting. The transmission of this message object is requested and is not yet done

field.name: RMTEN
field.description: Remote enable

enumeratedValue.name: TXRQST_UNCHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: TXRQST unchanged. At the reception of a remote frame, TXRQST is left unchanged.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRQST_SET
enumeratedValue.description: TXRQST set. At the reception of a remote frame, TXRQST is set.

field.name: RXIE
field.description: Receive interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: INTPND_UNCHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: INTPND unchanged. INTPND will be left unchanged after successful reception of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: INTPND_SET
enumeratedValue.description: INTPND set. INTPND will be set after successful reception of a frame.

field.name: TXIE
field.description: Transmit interrupt enable

enumeratedValue.name: INTPND_UNCHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: INTPND unchanged. The INTPND bit will be left unchanged after a successful transmission of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: INTPND_SET
enumeratedValue.description: INTPND set. INTPND will be set after a successful transmission of a frame.

field.name: UMASK
field.description: Use acceptance mask If UMASK is set to 1, the message object's mask bits have to be programmed during initialization of the message object before MAGVAL is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: USE
enumeratedValue.description: Use. Use mask (MSK[28:0], MXTD, and MDIR) for acceptance filtering.

field.name: INTPND
field.description: Interrupt pending

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. This message object is not the source of an interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. This message object is the source of an interrupt. The Interrupt Identifier in the Interrupt Register will point to this message object if there is no other interrupt source with higher priority.

field.name: MSGLST
field.description: Message lost (only valid for message objects in the direction receive).

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOST
enumeratedValue.description: Not lost. No message lost since this bit was reset last by the CPU.

enumeratedValue.name: LOST
enumeratedValue.description: Lost. The Message Handler stored a new message into this object when NEWDAT was still set, the CPU has lost a message.

field.name: NEWDAT
field.description: New data

enumeratedValue.name: NO_NEW_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: No new data. No new data has been written into the data portion of this message object by the message handler since this flag was cleared last by the CPU.

enumeratedValue.name: NEW_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: New data. The message handler or the CPU has written new data into the data portion of this message object.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DATA0
field.description: Data byte 0

field.name: DATA1
field.description: Data byte 1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DATA2
field.description: Data byte 2

field.name: DATA3
field.description: Data byte 3

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DATA4
field.description: Data byte 4

field.name: DATA5
field.description: Data byte 5

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DATA6
field.description: Data byte 6

field.name: DATA7
field.description: Data byte 7

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TXRQST16_1
field.description: Transmission request bit of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = This message object is not waiting for transmission. 1 = The transmission of this message object is requested and not yet done.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TXRQST32_17
field.description: Transmission request bit of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = This message object is not waiting for transmission. 1 = The transmission of this message object is requested and not yet done.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: NEWDAT16_1
field.description: New data bits of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = No new data has been written into the data portion of this Message Object by the Message Handler since last time this flag was cleared by the CPU. 1 = The Message Handler or the CPU has written new data into the data portion of this Message Object.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: NEWDAT32_17
field.description: New data bits of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = No new data has been written into the data portion of this Message Object by the Message Handler since last time this flag was cleared by the CPU. 1 = The Message Handler or the CPU has written new data into the data portion of this Message Object.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: INTPND16_1
field.description: Interrupt pending bits of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = This message object is ignored by the message handler. 1 = This message object is the source of an interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: INTPND32_17
field.description: Interrupt pending bits of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = This message object is ignored by the message handler. 1 = This message object is the source of an interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MSGVAL16_1
field.description: Message valid bits of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = This message object is ignored by the message handler. 1 = This message object is configured and should be considered by the message handler.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MSGVAL32_17
field.description: Message valid bits of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = This message object is ignored by the message handler. 1 = This message object is configured and should be considered by the message handler.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CLKDIVVAL
field.description: Clock divider value. CAN_CLK = system clock/(CLKDIVVAL +1) 0000: CAN_CLK = system clock divided by 1. 0001: CAN_CLK = system clock divided by 2. 0010: CAN_CLK = system clockdivided by 3 0011: CAN_CLK = system clock divided by 4. ... 1111: CAN_CLK = system clock divided by 16.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: reserved

register.name: PIO0_%s
register.description: Digital I/O control for port 0 pins PIO0_0 to PIO0_17. With glitch filter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only write 0 to these bits.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

field.name: HYS
field.description: Hysteresis.

field.name: INV
field.description: Invert input

enumeratedValue.name: INPUT_NOT_INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Input not inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 1; LOW on pin reads as 0).

enumeratedValue.name: INPUT_INVERTED_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Input inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 0, LOW on pin reads as 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: FILTR
field.description: Selects 10 ns input glitch filter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: OD
field.description: Open-drain mode.

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_DRAIN_MODE_ENAB
enumeratedValue.description: Open-drain mode enabled. This is not a true open-drain mode.

field.name: S_MODE
field.description: Digital filter sample mode.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_CLOCK_CYCLE
enumeratedValue.description: 1 clock cycle. Input pulses shorter than one filter clock are rejected.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_CLOCK_CYCLES
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clock cycles. Input pulses shorter than two filter clocks are rejected.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_CLOCK_CYCLES
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clock cycles. Input pulses shorter than three filter clocks are rejected.

field.name: CLKDIV
field.description: Select peripheral clock divider for input filter sampling clock IOCONCLKDIV. Value 0x7 is reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.
